rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101832

self.title: CDISC SDTM Findings About Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe findings about an event or intervention.
name: Findings About Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Findings About Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: Categorization of the type of acute myocardial infarction.
Action taken with respect to a device in a study, which may or may not be the device under study.
Action taken with respect to a subject in a study.
The agent, stimulus, activity, or event that causes stress with an acute frequency, which has the highest level of severity.
The age at which the first episode occurred.
The age at which the full-time use of a pre-specified object first occurred.
The age at which the first hospitalization event occurred.
The age at which illness-specific symptoms first began.
The age at which the first treatment for the condition occurred.
A measurement of the number of calories expended.
The method by which the coronary artery thrombosis event is determined or diagnosed.
terms.preferredTerm: Coronary Artery Thrombosis Method of Identification

terms.definition: The agent, stimulus, activity, or event that causes stress with a chronic frequency, which has the highest level of severity.
An indication as to whether the subject was admitted to a healthcare clinic.
The total amount that a subject is exposed to over time.
A determination of the total added sugars in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total dietary calories in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total carbohydrate in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total monounsaturated fat in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total polyunsaturated fat in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total saturated fat in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total fat in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total fiber in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total fruit in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total grain in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference. (NCI)
The quantity of a product that has been dispensed. (NCI)
The actual or calculated span between two points (real or virtual).
A determination of the total meat in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total magnesium in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A determination of the total protein in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
The state or condition of not responding to a pharmacological agent.
The number of devices inserted into an individual.
A determination of the total vegetables in a nutritional product or meal, or a portion thereof.
A description of the diagnostic criteria that the subject fulfilled in order to establish a medical diagnosis.
An indication as to whether the event meets the criteria for being a clinical endpoint.
The number of times an event, which is classified as mild, occurred.
The number of times an event, which is classified as moderate, occurred.
The total number of episodes that have occurred for the condition.
The number of times an event, which is classified as severe, occurred.
An approximate determination of the weight of the entity.
The number of times an event occurs within a given time period.
The total number of events that have occurred.
The length of time an individual spends exercising.
A determination or assessment of the degree or magnitude of an individual's exertion during physical activity.
A determination or assessment of the extent to which an individual adheres to a fitness program.
A description of the relative amount of tissue, blood vessel, or organ that has been removed.
Categorization of the type of healthcare encounter.
Categorization of the type(s) of new and/or worsening laboratory findings of heart failure present at the time of patient presentation.
terms.preferredTerm: Lab Findings of New or Worsening Heart Failure

terms.definition: Categorization of the type(s) of new and/or worsening physical exam findings of heart failure present at the time of patient presentation.
terms.preferredTerm: Physical Examination Findings of New or Worsening Heart Failure

terms.definition: Categorization of the type(s) of new and/or intensified treatment administered for heart failure management.
The total number of hospitalization events that have occurred for the condition.
An indication as to whether the ileocecal junction was removed.
An indicator as to whether the subject has symptoms of ischemic discomfort.
Categorization of the type of objective evidence of new or worsening ischemia.
The number of laps completed around a course or circuit.
The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.
A measurement of the total length of the removed tissue, blood vessel, or organ.
The number of lesions observed.
The anatomical location of the beginning or early stages of a disease.
A description of the series of events, including signs and symptoms, that define the course of a chronic disease over time.
An indication of whether a Type 1 and Type 2 myocardial infarction is excluded as a diagnosis.
terms.preferredTerm: Exclusion of Type 1 and Type 2 Myocardial Infarction Diagnosis Indicator
synonyms: Exclusion of Type 1 and Type 2 MI

terms.definition: A description of the clinical change to the subject after a non-invasive imaging procedure.
terms.preferredTerm: Clinical Change by Non-Invasive Imaging Procedure

terms.definition: A description of the new or worsening symptoms related to a clinical event.
The number of objects observed.
The type of object observed.
An indication as to whether something has happened, such as an event or incident.
An indication as to whether the primary site of cancer is known.
A categorization of the number of lesions present in the Central Nervous System at the time of diagnosis of a specific disease.
Categorization of the type of acute PCI angiographic complication resulting in acute myocardial ischemia.
terms.preferredTerm: Acute Myocardial Infarction From PCI Complication Type

terms.definition: The diameter of the lesion that has been determined to be the primary lesion.
The factor that causes or triggers the onset of an occurrence.
The quantity of a product that has been made ready for use.
The number of procedures performed on or in an individual.
An indication as to whether the procedure is considered successful.
The degree of urgency in which a medical procedure must be performed.
The anatomical location of the primary tumor site of disease.
The effect or consequence of an event or condition on an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.
The quantity of a product that remains after dosing, consumption, or use.
An indication as to whether the tumor has been resected.
The quantity of a product that has been returned. (NCI)
The relationship of an event to a device, which may or may not be a device under study.
The degree of something undesirable.
A scalar measure of the rate of movement of the object expressed as the distance traveled divided by the elapsed time.
The signs and/or symptoms that result in the discontinuation of treatment or intervention.
terms.preferredTerm: Sign or Symptom Leading to Discontinuation

terms.definition: Categorization of the timing of coronary stent thrombosis occurrence per the classification schema described by the Academic Research Consortium (ARC).
terms.preferredTerm: Academic Research Council Coronary Stent Thrombosis Timing

terms.definition: The number of footsteps taken by an individual.
The number of anatomical strictures observed.
Categorization of the type of stroke.
An indication as to whether the subject had symptoms related to the clinical event.
The date time of the onset of symptoms of the clinical event.
A measurement of the total number of entities.
A standardized categorical classification of the severity of an event or finding.
The surroundings or environment within which the subject receives therapeutic treatment for the condition.
The total amount of time during which an event, operation or activity has been interrupted or stopped.
The total amount of time during which an individual was actively engaged in physical activity.
An indication as to whether vessel occlusion, in the native or bypass graft, occurred within 48 hours after the coronary artery bypass graft procedure.
terms.preferredTerm: Vessel Occlusion 48 Hours after CABG Indicator

terms.definition: A measurement of the volume of a biological specimen.
